page.title: 08Travellers' Rest Farm
page.content: A{1500 acre farm}rented from the Crown, mainly cereals with sheep for meat. Wheat yields 3.5 tonnes/acre & barley 2.5 tonnes/acre. The land is chalk, of variable quality. Fertiliser is needed to maintain output. Farmer is a manager; he employs 5 & has 2 sons working as well.{Machinery {used:}Grain drier(Â£30000), 8 Tractors (Â£18000 each),2 Combines(Â£28000 each & traded after 4 yrs),Fork lift(Â£20000). Estimated value of the land is Â£800/ Â£900 an acre.The benefit of{the CAP}is difficult to assess; 1984 harvest gave 10% less in money than 1983.Farming is a business; information is sought from {Prestel Farmlink;}weather forecasting is much improved;the{NFU}was of value. Relations with{the School}were good though pupils were apt to be casual about the land.The farmer felt there could be more contact educationally.
